description.summary: A creamy and aromatic Indian chicken dish made with tender chicken in a rich tomato-based sauce with warming spices. Serve with rice or naan bread for an authentic experience.

preparation.step: In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tablespoon garam masala, 1 tablespoon cumin, and 2 tablespoons paprika. Add chicken pieces and marinate for at least 20 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook marinated chicken until golden, about 5-7 minutes per batch. Set aside.
In the same skillet, heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in remaining spices (2 tablespoons garam masala, 1 tablespoon cumin, 1 tablespoon paprika) and tomato paste. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in coconut milk and cooked chicken. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in remaining 1/2 cup yogurt and lime juice. Heat through without boiling.
Season with salt to taste and serve hot over rice or with naan, garnished with fresh cilantro.
